info.name: Godaigo
info.attribution:
Created and copyrighted by Jake Seegers.
VTT implementation by Jake Seegers and Michael Taylor.
Library image generated using the DALL.E  artificial intelligence image generator for the background, Ideogram.ai artificial intelligence image generator for the "Godaigo" text, and the remaining text and elements by Jake Seegers.
Rulebook Art uses original art by Jake Seegers for game elements such as Scroll Cards, Symbols, and Tiles, and Midjourney artificial intelligence image generator for art and background images.
info.description: Godaigo: Secret of the Five Elements is a strategic board game where players find and cast Elemental Scrolls to win. Players arrange Elemental Stones on the board, using their unique abilities to influence gameplay. The game offers a unique, booster-pack-free, spellcasting experience in every playthrough.
info.ruleText:
Watch this video for an overview: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vm3XSiSWG10&ab_channel=Godaigo.

In Godaigo, players must explore the board to find Elemental Scrolls, and be the first to cast one of each type to win the game.

To do this, the players must also acquire spell components called "Elemental Stones" and arrange them on the board in specific shapes.

This challenges players spatial strategy skills, and creates a game experience that is pleasing to the eye.

Additionally, these stones have their own unique abilities which affect movement and gameplay.

For example, an Earth Stone can be used to block a path or cut off a resource, or a Wind Stone can allow players to move more freely around the board.

Spells (or "Scrolls") can interfere with an opponent's strategy, or be used to manipulate the state of the board in your favor.

Godaigo: Secret of the Five Elements provides the fun of spellcasting card games, but does not require additional booster packs. The randomized board state makes each playthrough a unique experience.

Please read the rulebook provided in the "Rules Overview" section above and available as a link within the game.
info.helpText:
Two or more players take seats.  Click the "Restart" button to begin a new game.

Players are assigned tiles and colors automatically.  The player with tile 1 moves the tile to the edge of the board into a position touching at least two other tiles. Move the pawn to the center of the player tile. Press the "Turn" button to change the turn indicator. The next player places tile 2 and the matching pawn. Continue until all player tiles and pawns are on the board.

Click and drag on any empty spot on the play area to move the entire board.

Use the zoom buttons at the top of the screen as needed to change the view.

Click and drag on an empty spot inside the colored border of a player holder to move the entire holder.

Move stones from the storage area to your own player holder by clicking on a stone.

Drop a scroll card back onto its deck to turn it face down and automatically move it to the bottom of the pile.

Open the online rulebook via the Rules Overview section above or by clicking "Rules PDF" link in the game. 
View the Elemental Reference Sheet by clicking on the "Reference" button in the game. This button only displays the sheet to the player clicking the button. Click the button again to hide the reference sheet.

handReminder.text: You have exceeded the hand limit. Immediately move a card to your Active Scroll area, if you have space, or to the common area.
